intro: Gratiola oppositifolia, commonly known as the oppositeleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Gratiola oppositifolia is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained environments.
